description:
Chise Hatori has lived a life full of neglect and abuse, devoid of anything resembling love. Far from the warmth of family, she has had her share of troubles and pitfalls. Just when all hope seems lost, a fateful encounter awaits her. When a man with the head of a beast, wielding strange powers, obtains her through a slave auction, Chise's life will never be the same again.

(Source: Seven Seas Entertainment)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Fairy
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Chimera
tags.description: Features a beast made by combining animals, usually with humans.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

node.description:
[Website](http://junnarockyou.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/junnarockyou/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/junnarockyou/) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@junna_rockyou?) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnqOw96NU-jDDcFkEXGmnTg) | [Artist Profile](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A025763.html)

Junna Saka, better known as JUNNA is a Japanese pop singer managed by Cube Inc. and signed to FlyingDog.

JUNNA's hobbies include watching YouTube videos. Her favorite food is (dried foods) snacks.

JUNNA is a member of the real-life idol group, [Walküre](https://anilist.co/staff/226500/Walkre)

__Birthplace:__ Kushiro, Hokkaido, Japan

__[Website](http://junichimatsumoto.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/junichimatsumo4) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/junichimatsumotoof/) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/unichiatsumoto/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZunc5j3EHKSbN-TwAjqGg) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9D%BE%E6%9C%AC%E6%B7%B3%E4%B8%80)__

Junichi Matsumoto is a composer, arranger and keyboardist. He graduated from Kunitachi College of Music.

**Height:** 163cm

Akino Kawamitsu, better known by her stage name AKINO, is an American-born Japanese pop singer, from Utah. Originally debuting in 2003 with her brothers Akashi and Aiki and her sister Kanasa in the band bless4, Akino made her solo debut in 2005 singing the opening themes of the TV anime Sousei no Aquarion. Her debut album "Lost in Time" was released in 2007 under her new stage name, AKINO from bless4. All of her songs are composed by Yoko Kanno.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yumi_kawai_)

Kawai Yuumi is a director. She was born in Saitama, the capital of Saitama Prefecture. In 2011, she graduated from Tokyo Zokei University. In 2013, she earned a master's degree at the Graduate School of Film and New Media, Tokyo University of the Arts.

(Source: AniDB)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yumi_kawai_)

Kawai Yuumi is a director. She was born in Saitama, the capital of Saitama Prefecture. In 2011, she graduated from Tokyo Zokei University. In 2013, she earned a master's degree at the Graduate School of Film and New Media, Tokyo University of the Arts.

(Source: AniDB)

He initially aspired to be a professional mangaka and moved to Tokyo to pursue his dream. In 1971, he joined at Tatsunoko Pro as painter before becoming animator. After leaving the company he went freelance and participated in many works in different roles, ranging from key animator to episode director, before making his proper directorial debut with a short film titled Chicken Man & Red Head, which was a part of the [Robot Carnival](https://anilist.co/anime/2182/) anthology.

Nakamura revolutionized anime in the early '80s with his more realistic, extremely detailed and fluid style of animation. He is one of the few animators who has proven that he can successfully take on almost all of the creative burden on a project, proven in both his Robot Carnival short and episode 4 of [Hakkenden](https://anilist.co/anime/1822/).

His 2001 film, [A Tree of Palme](https://anilist.co/anime/1141/), was an official selection of the Berlin Film Festival.

[Website](http://kotringo.net/ktrng/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kotringo) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kotringo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kotringo717/)

Singer-songwriter, Composer and Pianist. She started playing piano when she was 5 years old. After graduating from KOYO SCHOOL OF MUSIC（current・KOYO SCHOOL OF MUSIC&DANCE), she went to study abroad in Boston, then graduated from Berklee College of Music with a Bachelor of Music in Jazz composition and a Bachelor of Music in Performance. In 2006, "Nichiyomachi (Waiting for Sunday)" which would become her 2nd single, was on air at the J-WAVE radio audition program "RADIO SAKAMOTO" navigated by Ryuichi Sakamoto, then she performed in "LOHAS CLASSIC Concert" also produced by Ryuichi Sakamoto. In the same year, she released "Konnichiwa mata ashita (Hello & See you)” produced by Ryuichi Sakamoto as her debut single in Japan. Since then, she has released 11 solo albums and 7 soundtrack albums. The latest solo album is “Ame no hakoniwa (My garden in the rain)” released in 2017. She composed the whole score in a long-running hit animated movie “Konosekai no Katasumi ni (In This Corner of the World)” released in November 2016, which led to her winning the 40th Japan Academy Film Prize for Outstanding Achievement in Music, the 71st Mainichi Film Awards for Best Music, and Best Music Award in the Osaka Cinema Festival 2017. Music of “In This Corner of the World” Concert, which represented the movie in a music concert, was well-received all over the country. At present, she has earned a high reputation as a singer-songwriter, composer and pianist with works on soundtracks for movies, dramas, animations, and commercials, and has a deeper expression of orchestra arrangements as well as performances. In recent years, the range of her voice expressions has expanded, including narration. In 2018, she visited Argentina on her first overseas tour, making all six performances a huge success and gained worldwide acclaim. She is now active as an artist who draws a pop world full of floating feelings with outstanding piano performance and soft singing voice.

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin, he joined [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/). Currently he mainly works with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/), but has previously worked for studios such as [Telecom](https://anilist.co/studio/94/), [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/) and [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

Made his debut as a director with [Hal](https://anilist.co/anime/16528/) in 2013.

Takuma Suzuki is an episode director. 

Not to be confused with the [voice actor](https://anilist.co/staff/101981) of the same name.
